wikipedia_page.main: John Creyghton Ainsworth-Davis  (23 April 1895 – 3 January 1976) was a Welsh surgeon and sprint runner who won a gold medal in the 4 × 400 m relay at the 1920 Summer Olympics.

response: * January 3 – John Ainsworth-Davis, Welsh surgeon and athlete (b. 1895)
*John Ainsworth-Davis (1895–1976), gold medallist at the 1920 Summer Olympics
